title: World reacts: â€˜We are a g shamblesâ€™
text:
â€˜Shamblesâ€™, â€˜rudderlessâ€™: Twitter reacts to Arsenal loss  24am Source: FOX SPORTS BAYERN Munich answered its critics with a comprehensive 5-1 rout of Arsenal in the first leg of their Champions League clash to put one foot in the quarterfinals. 
Thiago Alcantara struck twice in a superb performance, while Arjen Robben, Robert Lewandowski and substitute Thomas Mueller scored the other goals. 
Arsenal now faces what seems a near-impossible task in the second leg of the Round of 16 on March 7, despite a first-half equaliser from Alexis Sanchez. 
Hereâ€™s how Twitter saw Arsenalâ€™s defeat to Bayern Munich: 
â€œArsenal have completely disintegrated. An utter shambles and rudderless after koscielny went off.â€ -- Former England striker Gary Lineker @GaryLineker 
â€œWe are a g shambles.â€ -- Ex-Arsenal star Ian Wright @IanWright0 We are a g shambles ğŸ˜« â€” Ian Wright (@IanWright0) February 15, 2017 At least let it go to the g home leg ğŸ™ğŸ™ğŸ™ â€” Ian Wright (@IanWright0) February 15, 2017 **** it !!! Not watching anymore. ğŸ˜¡ â€” Ian Wright (@IanWright0) February 15, 2017 
â€œwell at least we can concentrate on finishing 4th in the league.. although thatâ€™s in doubt..â€ -- Golfer and Gunners fan Ian Poulter @IanJamesPoulter 
â€œIf I could left those 100lbs dumbbells i would throw them thru that TV... but Iâ€™m only strong enough to lift a digestive biscuit.â€ -- Poulter again 
â€œArsenal mullered.â€ -- Lineker 
â€œGreat lads bad result. At least the hotpot was good!!â€ -- Retired England cricketer Andrew Flintoff @flintoff11 
â€œItâ€™s taken Wenger a while, but heâ€™s finally got his team playing like Barcelona in Europe.â€ -- Sports website SportsJOE @SportsJOE_UK 
- Additional report from AFP and AP   View our Privacy Policy Bayern Munich's Spanish midfielder Thiago Alcantara (R) celebrate scoring the 3-1 goal with Bayern Munich's Polish forward Robert Lewandowski. Source: AFP Champions League Round of 16: Bayern Munich smash Arsenal 5-1, Real Madrid defeat Napoli 3-1  08am Source: FOX SPORTS ARSENE Wengerâ€™s future was plunged into further doubt on Wednesday as Thiago Alcantara inspired Bayern Munich to a 5-1 rout of his hapless Arsenal team which left the Gunners facing a seventh straight Champions League last-16 exit. 
Meanwhile, Real Madrid defeated Napoli 3-1 at home in their first leg clash. 
Bayern extended their Champions League record to 16 home wins by flooring the Gunners with three goals in ten second-half minutes. 
Bayern knocked Arsenal out at the same stage in 2005, 2013 and 2014 and were looking comfortably placed to make it four times after romping through Wednesdayâ€™s first leg. Read More
